intro: Centrosolenia lineata, commonly known as the lineated centrosolenia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, opposite leaves with a distinctive white midrib. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, arranged in clusters, and it produces small, round berries. It is often cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its attractive foliage and delicate blooms.
